definitions: Retrieved or recovered (something previously lost, given up, or taken away).
Converted (waste land or a desert) into land suitable for cultivation or habitation.
Brought (land) under cultivation from its natural state.
Demanded the return or restoration of (something).
examples: The lost luggage was reclaimed by its owner.
They reclaimed the marshland for farming.
The company reclaimed the abandoned property.
He reclaimed his dignity after the scandal.
The city reclaimed the waterfront for public use.
